newsitem.title: USA: Norland, Lilly form scanner deal.
newsitem.headline: Norland, Lilly form scanner deal.

text.p: Norland Medical Systems Inc said on Tuesday it had formed a collaborative marketing agreement with Eli Lilly and Co for its high-resolution micro-scanner.

Norland said in a statement it sold a prototype of its peripheral Quantitative Computed Tomography technology, used to research bone disease treatments. In return, Norland said it received a license to use certain software developed by Lilly which improved the scanner's resolution.
"The Lilly software enhances the resolution of the Norland scanner and we hope to sell the scanner with the software," a Norland spokesman said.

Norland Chairman and President said in a statement: "I hope that this agreement will lead to more powerful tools which will enable researchers to speed up the selection of therapies against osteoporosis."
The company declined to give a financial value for the agreement.
